abstract: The Syngenta chief executive told CNBC Europe on Thursday that Monsanto’s proposal was “woefully short” of addressing its concerns.
snippet: The Syngenta chief executive told CNBC Europe on Thursday that Monsanto’s proposal was “woefully short” of addressing its concerns.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — Monsanto continued to press its case on Thursday for a merger with the Swiss agricultural and chemical giant Syngenta, saying its rival doesn’t have “a long-term vision or plan” that would create the same value as Monsanto’s $45 billion offer.

headline.main: Monsanto Presses Case for Merger as Syngenta Reports Results
